Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the panel's determination that the applicant was inadmissible due to membership in a terrorist organization correct?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant joined LTTE at age 13, served until 21, claimed forced detention but panel found voluntary membership
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Panel's decision was reasonable and legally sound
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn IRB decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged errors in assessing membership and age factors
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credible evidence of voluntary membership and organizational terrorism
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claim of forced membership not supported by evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Service record with LTTE, duration of involvement, lack of escape attempts
Crimes.Application_Basis: Membership in organization engaging in terrorism or subversion
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Under IRPA s. 34(1)(f), membership in terrorist organization leads to inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence proving coercion or inability to leave
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk to national security due to association with designated terrorist group
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought to overturn IRB decision based on LTTE membership
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Panel properly assessed credibility and consistency of evidence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over judicial review of IRB decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Comprehensive evaluation of applicant’s testimony and background
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Voluntary membership established despite young age at entry
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: None found; evidence deemed credible and sufficient

Crimes.Crime_Name: Engaging in or instigating subversion by force of a government
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Threat posed by membership in armed insurgent group
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: LTTE engaged in organized subversive activities against Sri Lankan government
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Prolonged affiliation with designated terrorist organization
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Voluntary participation without credible evidence of duress
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Credibility of claim that applicant was detained and unable to leave
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Claim of forced retention not substantiated
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Duration of stay, lack of escape attempts, adult continuation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant not credible regarding coercion claims
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found applicant inadmissible due to subversive organization membership
Crimes.Process: Administrative hearing followed by federal court review
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Right to present evidence and be heard
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of procedural fairness – rejected
Crimes.Detention_Factors: Claimed detention by LTTE not accepted
Crimes.Length_of_Detention: Entire period of membership disputed as coercive
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: High – inadmissible person subject to removal

Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Potential threat through association and radicalization
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: LTTE is a listed terrorist organization under Canadian law
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Long-term active membership during formative and adult years
Crimes.Target_Entity: Civilian and state targets in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, organizational knowledge, public designations
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether age and coercion negate responsibility
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Failure to leave when possible, continued service as adult
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubt cast on claim of forced membership
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Applicant found to be a member of a terrorist organization
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider youth – addressed
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Panel provided coherent and lawful rationale
Crimes.Detention_Factors: Claim of being held against will

Crimes.National_Security_Element: Direct or indirect participation in terrorist acts
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Endangerment of public safety and international peace
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: LTTE responsible for suicide bombings, assassinations, attacks on civilians
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Membership in globally recognized terrorist organization
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Terrorist operations including bombings, assassinations, recruitment of child soldiers
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Seven-year active involvement starting at age 13
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Participation in structure and activities of terrorist group
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Credible evidence of LTTE’s terrorist nature and applicant’s role
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether applicant personally committed violent acts
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Membership itself sufficient under IRPA regardless of direct violence
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Continuation into adulthood weakens coercion argument
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claim of forced membership not persuasive
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural or evidentiary flaws noted
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Applicant inadmissible due to membership in terrorist organization
Crimes.Process: Administrative hearing and federal court appeal
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to factual findings
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Panel reasoning found logical and lawful
Crimes.Detention_Factors: Claimed inability to leave LTTE ranks
